definition: surname Lu/abbr. for Luxembourg 盧森堡|卢森堡[Lu2 sen1 bao3]
(old) rice vessel/black/old variant of 廬|庐[lu2]/(slang) (Tw) troublesome/fussy
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.chinese: 巴黎卢浮宫美术博物馆，夜10时46分。

sentences.english: Because the memory is so old. I think that I always came to the Louvre.
sentences.chinese: 因为这段记忆太古老了，我只记得我经常来卢浮宫。

sentences.english: The Loof museum said that she threw an empty mug at the Mona Lisa portrait last week.
sentences.chinese: 卢浮宫称她上周将一个空杯子扔向蒙娜丽莎画像。

sentences.english: Le Louvre museum is located in downtown Paris right bank of shore Seine, is the heart of Paris.
sentences.chinese: 卢浮宫位于巴黎市中心的赛纳河右岸，是巴黎的心脏。

sentences.english: The Louvre is also covered by the Paris Museum Pass .
sentences.chinese: 购买巴黎博物馆通票也可以进卢浮宫。

sentences.english: Have you taken the Louvre at all, sir?
sentences.chinese: 您在卢浮宫里多少还吃得开吧，先生？

sentences.english: The Louvre refused comment on the expected arrival of its new neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 卢浮宫拒绝就其即将到来的新邻居发表评论。

sentences.english: To enter visitors must descend below-ground before being taken back up to the main building.
sentences.chinese: 游客要进入必须先下到地下，然后回到卢浮宫主建筑。

sentences.english: And I want to propose to her in Paris, at the garden of Louvre.
sentences.chinese: 我想在巴黎向她求婚，在卢浮宫的花园里。

sentences.english: We were as different as the Louvre and Madison Square Garden.
sentences.chinese: 我们就像卢浮宫和麦迪逊加登广场一样迥然不同。

sentences.english: I would loiter in the palace the whole morning.
sentences.chinese: 我就整个上午“泡”在卢浮宫里。

definition: Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor
Ermitazh or Hermitage museum in St Peterburg

pinyin: Xiang1 xie4 li4 she4 Da4 jie1
